results.title: Turning, facing and boring
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Lathework series”.
A flanged bush of phosphor bronze is seen being machined from a rough casting, a job which introduced the operations mentioned in the title of the film. The different tools used are mounted on a four-way tool post, and each in turn is seen in use. Chamfering is also demonstrated.

results.title: An Introduction to the lathe
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lathework series”.
Various operations are shown briefly, then a simple type of lathe is examined systematically, headstock, cradle, tailstock, methods of holding the work by chucks, by face plate and between centres. Methods of feed, hand and automatic.

results.title: Taperturning
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lathework series”.
Three methods of taper turning are demonstrated and explained. 1. Offset tailstock. 2. Adjustment of compound slide. 3. Taper turning attachment.

results.title: Screwcutting
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lathework series”.
The film starts with a short general discussion of screw threads, pitch and shape. The principle of the screw-cutting lathe is illuatrated by mounting a wooden cylinder in the lathe and using a lead pencil instead of a cutting tool.

results.title: Japan: the collective giant
results.creator_credit: Gerald Renaud, Irwin Rosten, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Japan: imperial power to industrial giant”.
Deals with management-employee relationships of Japanese corporations and the fact that this country has a highly productive labor force which has become a threat to other countries. Points out that industrial prosperity can bring mixed blessings such as transport problems and pollution.

results.title: A Nation transformed 1945-1965
results.creator_credit: Gerald Renaud, Irwin Rosten, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Japan: imperial power to industrial giant”.
From the ashes of total defeat Japan rose in 21 years to an unparalleled economic and social level. The film portrays this remarkable recovery, noting the influences of MacArthur, the fierce national pride of the Japanese, and the new ideas of democracy. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Japan: a century of imperialism
results.creator_credit: Gerald Renaud, Irwin Rosten, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Japan: imperial power to industrial giant”.
Using documentary footage, this film traces the rise and fall of Japanese imperialism between the years 1850-1945. It gives insights into Japan’s internal political struggles, its militaristic philosophy, and the role of the United States in providing Japan with the tools of war.

group_works.title: Joe and Roxy
group_works.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Joe and Roxy
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Adolescence: perspective”.
The second of three dramas on adolescence, this film deals with teenagers in love. Joe and Roxy, at fifteen and sixteen respectively, face more than the usual number of teen-age problems. Roxy, the product of a broken home, tries to keep her romantic illusions alive against her mother’s worry and disappointment in life. Joe turns unsuccessfully to his father, a man of narrow mind and dull sensibilities, to help him decide his future. In their story the film contrasts the teenagers’ need for absolute rules with the confusion of adult standards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
